content.title: Pension Scheme (HBOCWWB)
content.details: The scheme 'Pension Scheme' is implemented by the Haryana Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (HBOCWWB). Under this scheme, a member of the fund who has been working as a building worker for not less than three years shall on completion of sixty years of age be eligible for a pension. The pension will become payable from the first day of the succeeding month in which he completes sixty years of age.
benefits: Under this scheme, a registered construction worker is given a pension of ₹3,250/- per month after the age of 60 years.
eligibility: Applicants should be registered with the Haryana Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board.
The registered worker must have a minimum of three years of regular membership before completing the age of 60 years.
The registered worker should not be availing the pension benefits from any other Department/Board/Corporation of the Haryana Government.
documents_required: Identity proof i.e. Aadhaar Card, Voter Card

faqs.question: At what age does a member become eligible for pension under the scheme?
faqs.answer: A member becomes eligible for pension upon reaching the age of sixty, provided they have been working as a building worker for at least three years.

faqs.question: When does the pension become payable?
faqs.answer: Pension becomes payable from the first day of the month succeeding the completion of sixty years of age.

faqs.question: What is the monthly pension amount provided under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The monthly pension amount is ₹3,250/- per month for registered construction workers who are sixty years or older.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for availing pension benefits?
faqs.answer: Applicants must be registered with the Haryana Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board and have at least three years of regular membership before turning sixty.

faqs.question: Are there any restrictions regarding pension benefits from other government entities?
faqs.answer: Yes, the registered worker should not be availing pension benefits from any other Department/Board/Corporation of the Haryana Government.

faqs.question: When should the life certificate be submitted?
faqs.answer: A life certificate must be submitted every year in November; failure to do so may result in the inability to receive pension benefits.

faqs.question: How can a construction worker register under the HBOCWWB?
faqs.answer: Construction workers can visit the Official Website of the Labour Department Haryana for registration.

faqs.question: Where can one apply for the scheme benefits?
faqs.answer: To avail of the scheme benefits, applicants need to visit the Official Portal - Antyodaya-SARAL Portal.
